project.teaser: The research ethics process is facing increasing challenges at a global level: new and emerging technologies present challenges to ethics reviewers who may be unskilled in the relevant fields; increased internationalisation of research has led to fears of ethics dumping; and...
project.objective: The research ethics process is facing increasing challenges at a global level: new and emerging technologies present challenges to ethics reviewers who may be unskilled in the relevant fields; increased internationalisation of research has led to fears of ethics dumping; and there is a lack of standardisation across Europe and the world. A key objective of national and EU research policy is to ensure compliance with the highest standards of research ethics. Given the impact of research on society, in terms of potential to generate innovative solutions to problems, and yet with the associated risk of harm, rigorous ethical research conduct is essential to ensure public trust in the scientific endeavour. irecs will address these problems in four ways. First, it will scan and map existing needs raised by new and emerging technologies in European and global research ethics communities. Second, it will produce and implement training materials for European and global audiences in research ethics communities. Third, it will conduct and permanently establish training programmes. Fourth, it will propose adaptations to the research ethics process in Europe. Through a unique blend of expertise, global partners and the involvement of European research ethics networks as partners or members of the Stakeholder Advisory Board, irecs will develop a fresh awareness of research ethics and sustainable, multi-purpose, multi-language interactive training programmes for different users. The project thus extends ENERI and the Embassy of Good Science into a horizontal community of research ethics practitioners, policy makers and other key stakeholders.
project.title: improving Research Ethics Expertise and Competences to Ensure Reliability and Trust in Science
project.keywords: Ethics review, Ethics training, Ethics dumping, Research ethics, Stakeholder engagement

article.title: Ethics and integrity: Building bridges for trust and excellence in research and innovation
article.teaser: Scientific and technological advancements raise complex ethical questions and may have significant societal impacts. The responsible and ethical use of scientific discoveries and novel technologies requires that reflection on the impacts and potential misuse of new technological developments is incorporated into the research process. The eight Horizon-funded projects featured in this Pack invite a rethinking of research governance systems, to ensure that scientific and technological progress, in all areas, goes hand in hand with the values we hold dear.

category.title: Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.title: Seven steps to strengthen research ethics governance
Ensuring ethics and integrity in organoid research
Ethics and integrity in times of crisis
Rethinking ethics and citizen participation in research and innovation
Ethics by design in cutting-edge tech development
Promoting responsible research practices at the institution level
Tools to achieve responsible and ethical open science
Integrating ethics into emerging technologies
article.teaser: Technological innovation is bringing huge benefits to healthcare and other critical sectors. Robust training and high-level expertise are needed to ensure that this is not at the expense of ethics.

article.title: Ethics and integrity: Building bridges for trust and excellence in research and innovation

result.title: Policy brief I
result.description: This deliverable is the first policy brief iRECS will develop and disseminate.

result.title: Report on the mapping of EU funded projects and networks
result.description: The report maps how iRECS relates to other projects and networks in the area of research ethics to provide the groundwork for creating synergies.

result.title: Aligning pedagogical foundations with technical developments
result.description: The report outlines how pedagogical foundations and technical developments will be aligned to generate learnercentred and userfriendly training materials

result.title: Recommendations to address ethical challenges from research in new technologies
result.description: The report outlines and elaborates recommendations to address research ethical challenges of new technologies that trainings and possible adaptations of review procedures need to consider

result.title: Report on case studies
result.description: This report outlines case studies of ethical challenges related to research on new technologies that will be further developed into training materials in WP4

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
